meanings.definition: A military force composed of ordinary citizens rather than professional soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The local militias trained together to protect their town.
meanings.sent2: During the war, militias were formed to defend the country.
meanings.sent3: The militias decided to have a friendly competition to improve their skills.
meanings.sent4: The militias stood like a shield against any threat to their community.
meanings.sent5: The image of the militias marching in unity was inspiring.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are not part of the regular army but are trained to fight in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent1: In times of crisis, the militias quickly mobilized to protect the city.
meanings.sent2: The militias were called upon to assist during the natural disaster.
meanings.sent3: The militias joked about being the city's secret defenders.
meanings.sent4: The militias were the unsung heroes of the emergency response.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the militias in action was reassuring to the citizens.

meanings.definition: An organized group of armed volunteers.
meanings.sent1: The local militias gathered regularly for training sessions.
meanings.sent2: The militias were always ready to assist in times of need.
meanings.sent3: The militias planned a picnic as a team-building activity.
meanings.sent4: The militias were a formidable force against any threat.
meanings.sent5: The dedication of the militias to their cause was evident to all.
